oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Statement of ordnance and ordnance stores pertaining to Company K, 5th Tennessee Volunteer Cavalry
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Robinson, Wingate Truitt, 1832-1903; United States -- Army -- Tennessee Cavalry Regiment, 5th (1862-1865); Ordnance; United States -- Army -- Ordnance and ordnance stores
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Printed Form No. 14, concerning charges to soldiers, specifies weapons damaged, lost, or destroyed and charged on muster and payrolls, first quarter of 1865; it also lists the names of soldiers and the conditions under which pistols were lost. Names listed: Sergeants James H. Smith and Francis M. Cullins; Privates James Bennett, Noah Smith, John B. Wilson, and William Patterson.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States -- Army -- Ordnance Corps.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Company K was an independent company mustered into Confederate service March 1862 and attached to the 5th Cavalry in May 1862.
